intro: Dryopteris meghalaica, commonly known as the Meghalaya wood fern, is a species of polypodioid fern native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its intricate fronds with a distinctive, finely divided structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices, thriving in humid climates. Its rhizome is thick and wiry, supporting the growth of its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
